main_definition: To force something (usually an obligation or a rule) to be accepted, obeyed, or followed by others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To establish an unwelcome or burdensome demand on someone
meanings_and_examples.example: The government decided to impose new taxes on luxury goods.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make something obligatory, typically by authority
meanings_and_examples.example: They imposed a curfew in the city during times of civil unrest.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To force oneself or one's beliefs upon others
meanings_and_examples.example: He tried to impose his religious views on his coworkers, but it caused tension at work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause something to be accepted by force of authority or will
meanings_and_examples.example: The school imposed strict dress codes for all students and staff members.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put pressure on someone to do something they are reluctant to do
meanings_and_examples.example: Her parents imposed the condition that she had to attend college if she wanted financial support.
